description: Rear T1 Acer spp x 1 This variegated maple has green leaved shoots throughout the canopy, in order to maintain the desired leaf pattern these need to be removed whilst the tree is still in leaf. Suggested work- remove green leaved branches and shoots Rear T2 Indian Bean Tree x 1 (Catalpa bignonioides) This 14m mature Indian bean tree has had cobra bracing installed previously. Suggested work: - remove internal deadwood - remove ivy (and inspect low unions) - remove some of the small branches on the canopies edge overhanging garden (to be directed by the client) Rear T3 Cherry x 1 (Prunus spp) 60% of the crown of this 6m cherry tree has died. Suggested work- fell to the height of the fence/ivy Rear T4 Viburnum x 1 This viburnum at the bottom of the garden has grown unruly. Suggested work: - reduce the height by 1.5m - prune edge to make flowing outline of canopy, that fits in with height of bushes/ivy/fence behind Rear T5 Laurel x 1 (Prunus spp) This laurel has been pruned previously, but ??240.00 is now encroaching upon the garden. Suggested work: - reduce back from the garden by 1-1.5m Rear G6 Holly x 1 (Ilex aquifolium) This holly tree and spindle bush has grown together and become unruly. Suggested work- reduce the height of the holly tree by 2m - trim and shape both into a neater more contained shape Rear T7 Pittosporum x 1 (Pittosporum tenuifolium tobira) This 8m pittosporum tree has grown over the ??340.00 roof, increasing risk of squirrels in the roof, and leaves blocking the gutters. It does provide some privacy from the neighbouring house windows. Suggested work- reduce the height by 2.5m, ensuring away from roof and gutters - thin by 15% Rear T8 Cotoneaster x 1 This cotoneaster on the boundary has grown at 45-degree angle away from the house and is covered in creeper. To reduce the risk of failure, suggested work: - reduce the lateral growth by 3m to a suitable growth point, including removing the clump of dead creeper Rear G9 Cotoneaster x 3 This group of
